title: language_test_3_14
prompt:
What is the best way to complete blank 14?

![dropdown:Drop_Down_705_86] would like to meet with you to discuss the available options.
feedback: The correct answer is "My sales manager and I." The sentence should read: “My sales manager and I would like to meet with you to discuss the available options.” This question asks you to pick the correct pronoun to use. When you use a pronoun in a group or series with other nouns, sometimes it’s difficult to tell which pronoun is correct. An easy way to tell is to remove the extra words and just use the pronoun in the sentence. “I would like to meet with you” sounds correct. “Me would like to meet with you” clearly sounds incorrect. That’s because the pronoun is the subject of the sentence, and it needs to be in the subjective case. “Me” is in the objective case, and “I” is in the subjective case. The correct subject is “My sales manager and I.”
